sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
 A rectangular water tank has length 17 m, breadth 3 m and capacity \(306 m^3\). 
 A model of the water tank is to made with capacity of \(38250 cm^3\). Find\\
 (i) the dimensions of the model\\
 (ii) the ratio of the total surface area of the tank to that model.\\
", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "$$\text{ Let,the model of the tank is made to scale } 1 : k,\\$$
 $$\text{Capacity of tank} = \input[s1v1]{}^3 \times Capacity of model\\$$
 $$(306 \times 100 \times 100 \times 100) = (k^3 \times 38250)\\$$
 $$k^3 = \frac{306 \times 100 \times 100 \times 100}{38250} = \input[s1v2]{}$\\$$
 $$k=\input[s1v3]{}\\$$"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
 $$(i) Length of the tank = k \times Length of the model\\$$ 
 $$\text{Length of the tank} = k \times \text{Length of the model}\\$$
 $$\input[s2v1]{} \times 100 = 20 \times \text{Length of the model}\\$$
 $$\text{Length of the model} =\input[s2v2]{} cm\\$$"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
 $$\text{Breadth of the tank} = k \times \text{Breadth of the model}\\$$
 $$\input[s3v1]{} \times 100 = 20 \times \text{Breadth of the model}\\$$
 $$\text{Breadth of the model} = \input[s3v2]{} cm\\$$"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
 \text{Height of the model} = \frac{Capacity of model}{length \times breadth}\\
 = \frac{38250}{85 \times \input[s4v1]{}} = \input[s4v2]{} cm\\$$"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "
 (ii)
 $$\text{Area of the Tank} = \input[s5v1]{}^2 \times \text{Area of the model}\\$$
 $$\frac{\text{Area of the Tank}}{\text{Area of the model}} = k^2 = \input[s5v2]{}\\$$
 $$\text{Area of the Tank} : \text{Area of the Model} = \input[s5v3]{} : 1$$ 
"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": ["k", 8000, 20], "text": "$$\text{Length, breadth and height of water tank} = k \times \text{Length, breadth and height of water tank respectively. Therefore, Capaciy of tank }= k^3 \times {Capacity of model, and solving for k we get }k=20\\$$"}, {"data": [17, 85], "text": "$$\text{Solving for length we get Length of the model }= 85 cm$$"}, {"data": [3, 15], "text": "$$\text{Solving for breadth we get breadth of the model }= 15 cm$$"}, {"data": [15, 30], "text": "$$\text{Solving for height we get height of the model }= 30 cm$$"}, {"data": ["k", 400, 400], "text": "$$\text{Since, Area of the Tank} = k^2 \times \text{Area of the model}\\\text{therefore, area of the tank }:\text{area of the model} = 400 : 1$$"}]
